machineStatus Class Reference

This class contains the machine's state for one canonical command. The information stored includes the coolant state, spindle speed and direction, feedrate, start and end pose, tool in use Important: 'pose' refers to how the machine's axes are positioned, while 'direction' refers to the direction of motion. More...

#include <machineStatus.hh>

Inherits canon.

Detailed Description

This class contains the machine's state for one canonical command. The information stored includes the coolant state, spindle speed and direction, feedrate, start and end pose, tool in use Important: 'pose' refers to how the machine's axes are positioned, while 'direction' refers to the direction of motion.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

machineStatus::machineStatus ( machineStatus const &  oldStatus  ) 

lastMotionWasTraverse gets copied from the previous machine status, and only gets changed if the prev status was motion at feedrate

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

machineStatus::machineStatus ( gp_Ax1  initial  ) 

This constructor is only to be used when initializing the simulation; it would not be useful elsewhere.

Parameters:
initial is the initial pose of the machine, as determined by the interp from the variable file.
See also:
machineStatus(machineStatus const& oldStatus)
